But first...we all deserve a laugh, don't we? Chuck Norris turns 80 today, so to celebrate we picked out some of our favorite Chuck Norris jokes:</p>

</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span>Well, that was certainly the craziest trading day the Brew has ever covered. And by crazy we mean terrible. Freaked out over a price war for crude oil, Wall Street had its </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/09/business/stock-market-today.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst day</a></span><span> since December 2008. </span>

And the S&P has now lost over </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-stocks-carnage/coronavirus-then-oil-collapse-erase-5-trillion-from-u-s-stocks-idUSKBN20W2TJ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$5 trillion in value</a></span><span> since a record high in February. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/circuit-breaker-triggered-historically-bad-day-wall-street?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Stock Market on Monday:
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A guy asking someone to turn it off and on " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTAvbWFya2V0X21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The IT Crowd</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a stock market safeguard was triggered after trading began like an I-95 pileup the day before Thanksgiving. Just as things seemed like they were falling apart, the circuit breaker activation was an important reminder that the financial system’s plumbing can handle the punches. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s a circuit breaker?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might be thinking of the control panel you track down after making toast and drying your hair at the same time. The financial one works the same way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few minutes into trading Monday, the S&P dropped 7%, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/sp-500-futures-are-frozen-after-tanking-5percent-heres-what-happens-when-circuit-breakers-kick-in.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">triggering</a> the Level 1 circuit breaker and pausing trading for 15 minutes. Had the S&P declined 13%, trading would’ve paused another 15 minutes. 20%, and everyone would have gone home for the day. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Circuit breakers were put in place after 1987’s Black Monday, when the Dow fell 22.6%. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The rules were revamped in 2013 after failing to prevent 2010’s “flash crash.” Yesterday was the first time the new ones activated. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Related: What happens if NYC shuts down the floors? </strong>In 2012, markets <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-stocks-factbox/factbox-a-7-plunge-in-the-sp-just-triggered-a-trading-halt-heres-how-circuit-breakers-work-idUSKBN20W1Z0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> because of Superstorm Sandy. The NYSE planned to go electronic but ended up woefully underprepared, so Wall Street scrapped the plans and just closed it. Since then, they’ve been running tests to go fully electronic jic.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nothing seemed out of the ordinary yesterday to NYSE President Stacey Cunningham: "I’m seeing markets <a href="https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/stock-market-news-today-030920/h_f3bf2624521964256478088e6903129d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">act normally</a>. They react to uncertainty...they become more volatile.” Feeling calm?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Maybe this’ll do the trick: </strong>The government <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-markets-are-awful-but-at-least-they-workfor-now-11583766336?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hasn’t yet enacted</a> crisis measures like it did during the financial crisis. Regulators are more alert (take the Fed’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/03/fed-cuts-interest-rates-stem-effects-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emergency rate cut</a> and $50 billion infusion to its overnight lending). Banks are in relatively good shape. And Girl Scout cookie sales are business as usual. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>President Trump said he'll <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/trump-says-hes-working-on-a-payroll-tax-cut-to-help-us-workers-amid-coronavirus-outbreak.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meet with lawmakers</a> today about "very substantial relief," including a possible payroll tax cut. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/oil-price-war-means-consumers-producers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Oil Price War (What Is It Good for?)
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President Trump tweeted this:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/157/trump_oil_tweet.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Trump tweet about oil "></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>@realDonaldTrump</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He's referring to oil prices collapsing the most since the Gulf War on Monday, following Saudi Arabia's declaration of a price war. In a dramatic bid for market share, the kingdom said it would sell its crude oil at <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bargain basement prices</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So how will the price war play out? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For consumers: </strong>Yes, lower oil prices mean <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/does-oil-price-plunge-mean-lower-prices-pump-n1153256?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lower prices</a> at the pump. The U.S. national average is currently around $2.38/gallon, but some analysts think it could drop below $2. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Energy industry: </strong>Obviously, not good. U.S. shale producers are already cash-strapped, and securing financing to pay down debt just got a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/59dcba56-61a2-11ea-b3f3-fe4680ea68b5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot more difficult</a>. Low oil prices could also deal a blow to oil-producing states, like Texas and North Dakota, that rely on high prices to sustain the industry. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>ExxonMobil stock dropped the most in 11 years.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The parallel shocks to demand (coronavirus) and supply (Saudi announcement) are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/oil-in-freefall-after-saudis-slash-prices-in-all-out-crude-war?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unprecedented</a>. "The situation we are witnessing today seems to have no equal in oil market history," said the executive director of the International Energy Agency.  </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/two-dozen-charged-horse-racing-doping-scheme?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Triple Crown of Doping Schemes
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="racehorse" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTUvaG9yc2VfcmFjaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>LiZardboy via Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For a break from coronavirus news...</strong>here's a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/horse-racing-trainers-veterinarians-charged-nationwide-doping-scandal-n1153126?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doping scandal</a> engulfing the horse racing industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Federal prosecutors charged 27 horse racing professionals yesterday over a scheme to secretly administer performance-enhancing drugs to racehorses under their care. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not only did those charged deceive the betting public, according to prosecutors, but they knowingly endangered the horses' lives with dangerous substances.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"What actually happened to the horses amounted to nothing less than abuse," said a federal official.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The headline name from the indictments was Jason Servis, the trainer of Maximum Security. That horse was the first to cross the finish line at the 2019 Kentucky Derby (it was DQ'd for interference), and since then the colt has won <a href="https://www.espn.com/horse-racing/story/_/id/28870928/over-2-dozen-horse-racing-professionals-charged-drug-scam?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four of five big races</a>, including $10 million at the Saudi Cup.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Professional horse racing is a $100 billion industry, so it's not surprising to see folks bending the rules to get a leg up. That, coupled with lax drug regulation in the U.S., has led to a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/09/sports/horse-racing-doping.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surge in deaths</a> at the racetrack, the NYT reports. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/amazon-begins-selling-cashierless-tech-retailers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Likes to Walk It Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="cashierless" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTQvYW1hem9uX2dvLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/shinyasuzuki/47946696396/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon Go</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-ND 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/shinyasuzuki/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shinya</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon has <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-store-technology/amazon-launches-business-selling-automated-checkout-to-retailers-idUSKBN20W0OD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">begun shopping</a> its cashierless checkout tech to other retailers. Called "Just Walk Out," the technology lets you just walk out of a store without paying, or more importantly talking to, anyone.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How <a href="https://justwalkout.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Just Walk Out</a> works: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You swipe your credit card at a turnstile to enter.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The technology that powers self-driving cars ("computer vision," "sensor fusion") keeps track of what you take off the shelf and put in your shopping cart.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then, you walk out and your credit card is charged.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon already uses this tech at 25 Amazon Go convenience stores and a full-sized, cashierless grocery store it opened in Seattle last month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is classic Bezos. </strong>First, you build a tool that's useful for your own operations, like a cloud computing platform. Then, make that tool so powerful everyone else wants a piece. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/03/09/amazon-selling-cashier-free-technology-to-other-retailers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concerns</a> some labor rights groups. "This so-called cashierless technology is nothing but a Trojan horse that will let Amazon control and monopolize competing retailers," said the president of the United Food and Commercial Workers International Union. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F09%2Famazon-begins-selling-cashierless-tech-retailers" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Choosing which stocks to invest in can feel a bit like trying to decide which Jenga piece to pull; assessment is crucial, and the inherent risks involved can be overwhelming.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s where <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/e-sa-5-stocks-under-50?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210046&psource=esamnbwdg0210046&wsource=esamnbwdg0210046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> comes in. <strong style="color:#000">Out of the nearly 2 million Brew subscribers, 5,306 have joined</strong> <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/e-sa-5-stocks-under-50?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210046&psource=esamnbwdg0210046&wsource=esamnbwdg0210046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motley Fool Stock Advisor</a>—the stock-picking service that’s recommended<strong style="color:#000"> some of the hottest stocks before they ever sizzled</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These examples need no introduction:</p>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a member of the <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/e-sa-5-stocks-under-50?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-50dollars&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0210046&psource=esamnbwdg0210046&wsource=esamnbwdg0210046" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motley Fool Stock Advisor</a>, you’ll get alerted to their <strong style="color:#000">5 Growth Stocks Under $49</strong> before they potentially blow up, so you can worry about risking lesser things. Like a Jenga pull from the bottom of the stack.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/theaters-age-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Theaters in the Age of Coronavirus
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="broadway dancing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/156/broadway_dancing.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="broadway dancing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/156/broadway_dancing.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/CBS</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Melpomene was onto something with that mask. Attendance at NYC's Broadway shows has not only <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-09/broadway-shows-stay-popular-in-the-face-of-coronavirus-outbreak?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">held steady</a> at 250,000 weekly visitors, but actually increased last week just as coronavirus push alerts were learning to harmonize. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out a global epidemic doesn't even get you 10% off <em>Hamilton</em>. The average ticket price is down $6 annually to $105.35, or the price of one sanitizing hand wipe at your local Amazon Go. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And the movies?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The North American box office is doing <a href="https://apnews.com/6bf7b300845f5e1c12cf555c2526dfdb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as well as imaginable</a> considering Disney's <em>Onward</em> and Ben Affleck's <em>The Way Back</em> are the latest releases. The pair brought in $48.5 million last weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But if you don't live in the land of bottomless jumbo popcorn, it's shakier. After record 2019 revenues, the international box office is <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/film-industry-facing-5-billion-loss-coronavirus-outbreak-1282038?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">feeling feverish</a>, especially China and Japan, the second and third largest film markets. Some analysts expect at least a $5 billion loss from box office declines and disrupted production schedules.</p>

PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Bombas podcast episode " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTgvYm9tYmFzX3BvZGNhc3RfZXBpc29kZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know that feeling when you change the toilet paper roll? Or say “it’ll come out in the wash” instead of Venmo requesting your friends?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Being a B Corp feels like all of that at once.</strong> B Corp companies strive to “balance purpose and profit”—like Bombas, the digitally native sock company with a cult following and a give-back model.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual </em>podcast</strong>, Bombas CEO Dave Heath explains why missions to “do good” can coexist with “do profit.” Plus, you'll hear why…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Authenticity is more convincing than viral marketing</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Starbucks ought to write the book on product-market fit</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Venture capital sets any non-tech investment up for failure</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">About that last one...Heath poses some of the hottest takes <em>Business Casual</em> has seen.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hear for yourself: </strong><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/daveheath_apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/daveheath_spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/daveheath_all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWell, that was certainly the craziest trading day the Brew has ever covered. And by crazy we mean terrible. Freaked out over a price war for crude oil, Wall Street had its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/09/business/stock-market-today.html?action=click\u0026module=Spotlight\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworst day\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since December 2008. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/google/223/shocked-face-with-exploding-head_1f92f.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e numbers: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver 3,500 stocks traded on the NYSE hit 52-week lows. And the S\u0026P has now lost over \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-stocks-carnage/coronavirus-then-oil-collapse-erase-5-trillion-from-u-s-stocks-idUSKBN20W2TJ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$5 trillion in value\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since a record high in February. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/09/circuit-breaker-triggered-historically-bad-day-wall-street?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Stock Market on Monday:\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A guy asking someone to turn it off and on \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTAvbWFya2V0X21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe IT Crowd\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, a stock market safeguard was triggered after trading began like an I-95 pileup the day before Thanksgiving. Just as things seemed like they were falling apart, the circuit breaker activation was an important reminder that the financial system’s plumbing can handle the punches. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s a circuit breaker?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might be thinking of the control panel you track down after making toast and drying your hair at the same time. The financial one works the same way.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA few minutes into trading Monday, the S\u0026P dropped 7%, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/sp-500-futures-are-frozen-after-tanking-5percent-heres-what-happens-when-circuit-breakers-kick-in.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etriggering\u003c/a\u003e the Level 1 circuit breaker and pausing trading for 15 minutes. Had the S\u0026P declined 13%, trading would’ve paused another 15 minutes. 20%, and everyone would have gone home for the day. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCircuit breakers were put in place after 1987’s Black Monday, when the Dow fell 22.6%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe rules were revamped in 2013 after failing to prevent 2010’s “flash crash.” Yesterday was the first time the new ones activated. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRelated: What happens if NYC shuts down the floors? \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2012, markets \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-stocks-factbox/factbox-a-7-plunge-in-the-sp-just-triggered-a-trading-halt-heres-how-circuit-breakers-work-idUSKBN20W1Z0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed\u003c/a\u003e because of Superstorm Sandy. The NYSE planned to go electronic but ended up woefully underprepared, so Wall Street scrapped the plans and just closed it. Since then, they’ve been running tests to go fully electronic jic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNothing seemed out of the ordinary yesterday to NYSE President Stacey Cunningham: \"I’m seeing markets \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/stock-market-news-today-030920/h_f3bf2624521964256478088e6903129d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eact normally\u003c/a\u003e. They react to uncertainty...they become more volatile.” Feeling calm?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMaybe this’ll do the trick: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-markets-are-awful-but-at-least-they-workfor-now-11583766336?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehasn’t yet enacted\u003c/a\u003e crisis measures like it did during the financial crisis. Regulators are more alert (take the Fed’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/03/fed-cuts-interest-rates-stem-effects-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemergency rate cut\u003c/a\u003e and $50 billion infusion to its overnight lending). Banks are in relatively good shape. And Girl Scout cookie sales are business as usual. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ePresident Trump said he'll \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/09/trump-says-hes-working-on-a-payroll-tax-cut-to-help-us-workers-amid-coronavirus-outbreak.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeet with lawmakers\u003c/a\u003e today about \"very substantial relief,\" including a possible payroll tax cut. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: for?)\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President Trump tweeted this:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/157/trump_oil_tweet.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"Trump tweet about oil \"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003e@realDonaldTrump\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe's referring to oil prices collapsing the most since the Gulf War on Monday, following Saudi Arabia's declaration of a price war. In a dramatic bid for market share, the kingdom said it would sell its crude oil at \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebargain basement prices\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo how will the price war play out? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor consumers: \u003c/strong\u003eYes, lower oil prices mean \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/does-oil-price-plunge-mean-lower-prices-pump-n1153256?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elower prices\u003c/a\u003e at the pump. The U.S. national average is currently around $2.38/gallon, but some analysts think it could drop below $2. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnergy industry: \u003c/strong\u003eObviously, not good. U.S. shale producers are already cash-strapped, and securing financing to pay down debt just got a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/59dcba56-61a2-11ea-b3f3-fe4680ea68b5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elot more difficult\u003c/a\u003e. Low oil prices could also deal a blow to oil-producing states, like Texas and North Dakota, that rely on high prices to sustain the industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExxonMobil stock dropped the most in 11 years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe parallel shocks to demand (coronavirus) and supply (Saudi announcement) are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-08/oil-in-freefall-after-saudis-slash-prices-in-all-out-crude-war?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunprecedented\u003c/a\u003e. \"The situation we are witnessing today seems to have no equal in oil market history,\" said the executive director of the International Energy Agency.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoping scandal\u003c/a\u003e engulfing the horse racing industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFederal prosecutors charged 27 horse racing professionals yesterday over a scheme to secretly administer performance-enhancing drugs to trainer of Maximum Security. That horse was the first to cross the finish line at the 2019 Kentucky Derby (it was DQ'd for interference), and since then the colt has won \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/horse-racing/story/_/id/28870928/over-2-dozen-horse-racing-professionals-charged-drug-scam?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour of five big races\u003c/a\u003e, including $10 million at the Saudi Cup.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eProfessional horse racing is a $100 billion industry, so it's not surprising to see folks bending the rules to get a leg up. href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-store-technology/amazon-launches-business-selling-automated-checkout-to-retailers-idUSKBN20W0OD?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" Called \"Just Walk Out,\" the technology lets you just walk out of a store without paying, or more importantly talking to, anyone.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow \u003ca href=\"https://justwalkout.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eJust Walk Out\u003c/a\u003e works: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou swipe your credit card at a turnstile to enter.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe technology that powers self-driving cars (\"computer vision,\" \"sensor fusion\") keeps track of what you take off the shelf and put in your shopping cart.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThen, you walk out and your credit card is charged.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon already uses this tech at 25 Amazon Go convenience stores and a full-sized, cashierless grocery store it opened in Seattle last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is classic Bezos. \u003c/strong\u003eFirst, you build a tool that's useful for your own operations, like a cloud computing platform. Then, make that tool so powerful everyone else wants a piece. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2020/03/09/amazon-selling-cashier-free-technology-to-other-retailers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcerns\u003c/a\u003e some labor rights groups. \"This so-called cashierless technology is nothing but a Trojan horse that will let Amazon control Attendance at NYC's Broadway shows has not only \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-09/broadway-shows-stay-popular-in-the-face-of-coronavirus-outbreak?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheld steady\u003c/a\u003e at 250,000 weekly visitors, but actually increased last week just as coronavirus push alerts were learning to harmonize. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out a global epidemic doesn't even get you 10% off \u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e. The average ticket price is down $6 annually to $105.35, or the price of one sanitizing hand wipe at your local Amazon Go. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd the movies?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe North American box office is doing \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/6bf7b300845f5e1c12cf555c2526dfdb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas well as imaginable\u003c/a\u003e considering Disney's \u003cem\u003eOnward\u003c/em\u003e and Ben Affleck's \u003cem\u003eThe Way Back\u003c/em\u003e are the latest releases. The pair brought in $48.5 million last weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut if you don't live in the land of bottomless jumbo popcorn, it's shakier. After record 2019 revenues, the international box office is \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/film-industry-facing-5-billion-loss-coronavirus-outbreak-1282038?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efeeling feverish\u003c/a\u003e, especially China and Japan, the second and third largest film markets. Some analysts expect at least a $5 billion loss from box office declines and disrupted production schedules.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F09%2Ftheaters-age-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
